article_node.title: The Wollman Rink lesson: Why Trump succeeds where Democrats fail
article_node.summary: The article discusses President Trump's historical ability to address cultural issues and his recent comments on crime and governance. It highlights his successful reopening of the Wollman ice-skating rink in 1986 as a metaphor for his approach to tackling bureaucratic inefficiencies. Trump criticizes Democrats for their inaction on crime and other issues, asserting that they are unwilling to collaborate for the benefit of the public. He emphasizes his administration's achievements and positions himself as a champion for safety and working-class interests.
